hero.title: The trustless identity layer for Polkadot JAM
hero.subtitle: JAMID defines a new open standard for identity ‚Äî one that belongs to the network, not to a company. Identities are stored on-chain, secured by cryptography, and governed collectively by the community.

vision.title: A self-sovereign identity for the JAM era
vision.text: JAMID is a smart contract that defines identity as a public good. It allows anyone to register a verifiable JAM Identity (JID) directly on-chain, without intermediaries or custodians. Ownership is proven through cryptography ‚Äî not administration.

items.title: Connected
items.description: Works across JAM and all Polkadot parachains.

items.title: Governable
items.description: Fees fund the ecosystem, not private entities.

governance.title: Governed by the Polkadot Treasury
governance.text: All protocol fees collected by JAMID are redirected to the Polkadot Treasury. Its evolution is managed collectively through the OpenGov system. Snowinch contributed JAMID as an open public good and continues to maintain it under Treasury oversight.

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: JAMID is written in Rust and built with ink! It is verifiable, auditable, and immutable by design. Deployed on JAM testnet and designed for open contribution.
specs: No admin key or owner control

footer.subtext: Contributor to the Polkadot OpenGov ecosystem.
